data.title: TheStadiumBusiness Summit
data.text:
Operations, Technology & Sustainability

Emirates Old Trafford, Manchester

The Factory of Memories

Now in its second decade, TheStadiumBusiness Summit continues to adapt and reflect the needs of its industry. We‚Äôre embracing Technology, Innovation and Transformation to re-define the global #1 venue business showcase. Join your colleagues from all around the world as we bring together the leading stadium, arena and venue executives to explore the future of our business.

Who? What?

Each year TheStadiumBusiness Summit hosts the world‚Äôs leading gathering of key thinkers, movers and shakers from across the global sports and entertainment world.

Network with everyone that‚Äôs worth networking with.

Like no other event, we bring together the global stadium, arena and entertainment venue business. Our proven formula (Compact Footprint x Quality Content = Maximum Knowledge Transfer) remains the same.

The speakers and attendees you can expect range from owners and executives to architects and leading venue suppliers.

Simply the best knowledge and networking event there is.

Our Delegates

Our attendee profile comprises:

Owners, operators and investors in sports / entertainment venues;

C-Level execs in teams / venues (President / GM / CEO, CEO, COO, CFO, CTO, CMO and Head of Depts);

City Councils / Municipalities / Regional Agencies (mayors, economic development, sports / recreation / leisure, arts / culture & tourism departments);

Sports Federations, Sports Clubs (professional and amateur), governing bodies, sports event bid committees, sports tourism officials etc;

National and regional Sports/Events bodies;

Events / Sponsors / Rightsholders;

Architects / Designers / Consultants;

Product & Service Suppliers to the venue sector.

View latest Attendance updates here

Ingredients to Success

The Summit is a business networking event with a total focus on quality. That means quality attendance, quality content and quality connections. It is NOT a trade show but instead a Networking Event. We have developed a format to maximise connections over two days (and two nights).

The key elements to fostering learning and connections include:

THE CONFERENCE ‚Äì 50+ expert industry speakers covering the topics you need to hear about, across multiple stages with dedicated tracks around Technology, Innovation and Transformation in design and development;

THE MARKETPLACE ‚Äì Our dedicated networking area ‚Äì where all refreshments and lunches are served ‚Äì is ringed by a curated, mini-expo of 25-30 suppliers on ‚Äòdemo-pods‚Äô showcasing the latest innovations and solutions;

LISTEN HERE. BE THERE ‚Äì Two places at once? Tune in to chosen conference tracks (in different parts of the Summit), whilst networking in another;

NETWORKING & INTROS ‚Äì Someone you want to meet? A venue you‚Äôd love to learn from? Let us know and we‚Äôll do our best to make the introduction.

And, as always, the Summit retains its ‚Äòfamily vibe‚Äô ‚Äì bringing together old friends with new faces to the fold. Want to join us? Questions? Email us here

VIP Guest Programme

Free delegate passes to venues, teams and operators looking to #reimagine their business.

For more than a decade the Summit has gathered together the sector‚Äôs key thinkers, movers and shakers.

Our VIP guest programme provides free delegate passes to teams, venues and leagues which we believe will add value, knowledge and experience to the Summit ‚Äì and, in turn, take back to their organisations from their own attendance.

Do you qualify for a free Guest VIP ticket?

Here are the Guest VIP Programme requirements:

You are employed by a Venue, Team, or Operating company;

You are C-Level/Director or Senior Management;

You want to learn how to improve your venue operationally, increasing revenue and retention;

Your organisation has not attended the Summit in the last three years.

Interested? Get in touch with Angelina, who runs the VIP Guest Programme here.

Here‚Äôs a sampling of organisations attending our previous summits:

Goodwood Group

ECB ‚Äì England and Wales Cricket Board

Chester Race Company

Leicester City FC

Manchester Central Convention Complex

Lancs Cricket/Emirates Old Trafford

Etihad Arena (Yas Bay)

FC Copenhagen

Parc Olympique

PZPN (Poland FA)

Federation International de Volleyball

Manchester City FC

Scottish Event Campus

Portsmouth FC

Speakers - Panelists - Judges

Do you have all the answers? If not, then why not invest some time to learn from others?

Chris May

oining BC Pavilion Corporation (PavCo) in 2022, Chris May serves as General Manager of BC Place Stadium, bringing over 20 years of strategic leadership experience in executing diverse, large-scale events for international markets.

Chris has planned, managed and provided strategic direction for major live events in markets across the globe. From live concerts, musicals, TV telethons, and special events, to international touring logistics, he has ensured the successful execution of events welcoming tens of millions of people around the globe.

Previously, Chris served as Vice President, Delivery and Production, and Executive Producer, at SDImktg, where he led the development of long-term major event strategies for new and existing clients, and guided execution for the agency‚Äôs portfolio for major events such as Rogers Hometown Hockey Tour. Before that, Chris acted as Senior Director of Touring Operations with Cirque Du Soleil, responsible for arena touring shows Saltimbanco, Alegria, and Varekai. He also managed the company‚Äôs first tours to 23 new markets including Qatar, Turkey, Lebanon and Hungary.

Chris works extensively with Embers, a Social Enterprise based in Vancouver‚Äôs Downtown Eastside that provides employment opportunities to individuals with barriers to employment, serving as Chair of the Board of Directors. He is also the Chair of the Board of Directors for Firehall Arts Centre, where he provides support for the city‚Äôs oldest performance venue, which hosts two hundred performances each year.

Gina Woodburn

Gina is the Chief Executive Officer of the DHL Stadium in Cape Town South Africa. The DHL Stadium is a multi-purpose stadium with a capacity of 58 000 spectators. Prior to taking up the position of CEO for the stadium, Gina was the Marketing and Commercial Manager for 3 years and instrumental in developing and implementing the stadium‚Äôs commercial programme. This has included securing a naming rights partner, an anchor tenant in Western Province Rugby as well as implementing the commercial event day services such as hospitality, concessions and spectator experience.

Prior to joining the DHL Stadium, Gina was Chief Operating Officer for Group Africa Marketing overseeing the business of sports sponsorship, PR and brand activation in South Africa and Sub-Saharan Africa. Prior to that Gina was Commercial Executive for the SAIL Group which included developing and implementing various sports tournaments and entertainment properties in South Africa.

Graeme Pacitti

A former Chef and Restaurateur, Graeme has been overseeing the development of the Hospitality Operations for Heart of Midlothian Football Club and Edinburgh‚Äôs Tynecastle Park for over three decades.

Graeme joined the Hearts team full-time, after years with organisations tasked with running external stadia and catering operations across Scottish venues.

Under Graeme‚Äôs leadership, the whole catering and events operation at Heart of Midlothian has been brought in house, growing to become a vital ¬£5 million annual revenue stream for the club.

The opening of Tynecastle Park Hotel has been driven by Graeme and a team of Hearts leaders, ensuring future revenue for the club and finishing off the Main Stand construction project which began back in 2017.

Graeme and his Operations team strive to elevate the Hotel, Restaurant, Event, and Matchday experience at Tynecastle Park by providing top-notch and diverse food and beverage options, making it one of the finest offerings in Scotland, acknowledged with numerous accolades.

As part of his commitment to the industry, he sits on the Board of Scottish Chefs to help the future leaders of the hospitality and catering industry.

Rhiannon Martin

Rhiannon has over 25 years experience and knowledge of planning and delivering football tournaments and events around the world.

Responsible for leading the planning and delivery of the operations for the FIFA U-20 Women‚Äôs World Cup France 2018, FIFA Women‚Äôs World Cup France 2019 and FIFA Women‚Äôs World Cup Australia & New Zealand 2023 .

Wide range of responsibilities including leading the FIFA project team. Key tasks include strategy, planning and delivery of the tournament; issue tracking and resolution; liaising with and advising the Local Organising Committee; stadium planning and venue management; project management; budgeting; providing content for legal documents; reporting to senior management; competition matters and team services; drawing up match schedules and Regulations; FIFA General Coordinator management during competition-time; training site selection. Also responsible for planning and delivery of draw shows and team workshops.

Phil Davis

With a career spanning 20 years in the football industry, I have dedicated my expertise to areas such as cybersecurity, digital infrastructure, CRM and data management, digital fan experiences, and football insights. These areas have been instrumental in driving technological advancements that enhance operational efficiency and fan engagement.

Jen Mitchell

Jen is an MBA qualified, highly adaptable Managing Director and venue professional with a long-standing background in music, arts, media, corporate and sports events across the UK and Middle East.

Starting life at ASM Global at the first direct Arena, Leeds, Jen spent five years working as General Manager, leading the team successfully through an array of industry challenges and venue enhancements. She has since joined the team at the AO Arena, heading up the ¬£50 million redevelopment that will bring a level of extravagant guest experiences that no venue has seen before.

With 23+ years working in the venue and entertainment industry, Jen‚Äôs varied career includes working with venues and festivals from 400 seats to 80,000, with teams ranging from 30 to 800 staff. Having worked around the world in places such as Qatar and Australia, as well as prestigious UK venues such as the opening of King‚Äôs Palace, London, it is Jen‚Äôs strong emphasis on output, efficiency and quality that will successfully position the AO Arena as the UK‚Äôs first live music venue to have a luxury restaurant and bar experience in-house.

Adrian Doyle

With almost 30 years‚Äô experience in the live events and entertainment industry, Adrian has a grounding in the hospitality sector, entering into venue management at Wembley Stadium Ltd, before subsequently relocating to Belfast in 2000 to join the then Odyssey Arena (now The SSE Arena, Belfast) management team, ahead of the venue‚Äôs historic opening at the turn of the millennium.

With a reputation for driving advancement and innovation in visitor experience, Adrian played a pivotal role in putting Northern Ireland‚Äôs leading entertainment venue on the global map. In 2015, Adrian moved from his position as General Manager of the Arena to The Odyssey Trust, and now holds the role of Chief Experience Officer, with responsibility for the operating performance of The SSE Arena, Belfast, the Belfast Giants, and W5 Science & Discovery Centre.

A Board member of the European Arenas Association, Adrian has driven a commitment to achieve the Best Experience Every Time for customers across the Odyssey site, and is a passionate advocate that people are at the heart of everything that The Odyssey Trust does.

Justine Hewitt

Justine Hewitt, Head of Stadium Operations, joined Leicester City Football Club in April 2020 and has responsibility for matchday and non-match day operations, health and safety, security, housekeeping and maintenance at both the King Power Stadium and the Club‚Äôs Women‚Äôs training facility, Belvoir Drive. Justine has worked in the sport and leisure industry for over 20 years and is experienced in managing multi-purpose facilities hosting an array of sport, business and entertainment events. Previous roles include a brief spell at Emirates Old Trafford, and 15 years at Ricoh Arena (now CBS Arena), where she held the starting position of Exhibition Coordinator through to Operations Director and has overseen the delivery of domestic and international football, rugby, London 2012 Olympic football fixtures, both stadium bowl and indoor arena concerts as well as managing a site with various tenants, hotel and casino.

Stephane Bazire

Stephane is Head of Business Sustainability at Silverstone Circuit, Stephane is leading the team to transform the iconic home of British Motorsport and host of the F1 British GP to become a sustainable business and leisure destination. Specialized in change management, sustainable development, event/venue operations and impact driven partnership, he brings over 20 years of experience mainly acquired in the sports industry through his collaboration with the ATP World Tour and WTA Tennis circuits, ITF, FIBA 3√ó3, FIFA Confederations Cup, World Roller Games, Mediterranean Games, F1 and MotoGP.

His main objective at Silverstone is to drive Silverstone Shift to Zero sustainability strategy and decarbonization roadmap implementation, including carbon footprint accounting, FIA 3* and ISO 14001/20121 certifications, installation of 2764 solar panels and 24 EV charging points, switching to renewable energy including HVO Biofuel in all temporary generators, reducing single use plastic to 100% by 2026 and getting a low emission fleet of vehicles by 2030.

Silverstone is signatory of the UNFCCC Sport for Climate Action committed to reduce 50% of its carbon emission by 2030 and achieve Net Zero before 2040.

Vicky Jaycock

Vicky has worked in the stadium and venues industry for over 15 years, specialising in premium sales strategy for transformative renovations and new build projects. Projects include M&S Bank Arena, Liverpool FC‚Äôs Main Stand re development and she now leads the go to market strategy of ‚ÄòALL‚Äô Bars, Restaurants & Experiences at Everton‚Äôs impressive new 52,888-seater home. Vicky has a passion for innovation across premium sales and experiences and is driven by shaping customer journeys that appeal to a wider range of fan profiles. Vicky enjoys contributing to industry conferences and discussions across a range of topics, believing that collaboration across the stadia and venues industry inspires best in class delivery.

Sean Marshall

Sean Marshall, Head of Technology at Co-op Live, flagship venue of Oak View Group (OVG) who will share his journey in transforming and optimising workforce management across three major sports, stadium, and hospitality businesses.

Sean Marshall is a seasoned and passionate Head of IT/IT Manager with a proven track record in transforming and driving innovation within major multi-purpose stadium and arena businesses.

With a career entirely devoted to the sports and entertainment industry, Sean thrives in what he considers the most dynamic and exciting sectors for IT professionals. His unique approach to IT not only sets him apart but also positively impacts every department he collaborates with.

For Sean, every day is a learning and teaching opportunity!

Alan Graham

Alan Graham is one of Australia‚Äôs most experienced and respected executive level venue and event managers with a career in the industry spanning 28 years.

As General Manager of Suncorp Stadium, a venue owned by Stadiums Queensland and operated under contract by ASM Global, he is responsible for developing and driving the business of one of Australia‚Äôs busiest Stadiums.

The venue averages around 50 major events per year and is the home ground of 4 Anchor Tenants competing in national competitions:

Brisbane Broncos (National Rugby League)

Dolphins (National Rugby League)

Queensland Reds (Super Rugby Competition)

Brisbane Roar (National A-League Football Competition)

The Stadium is also host to a number of other Blockbuster Events including:

NRL Magic Round (all 8 games of an entire round played at the venue over 3 days)

State of Origin Men‚Äôs and Women‚Äôs Rugby League Matches

Wallabies Rugby Tests

Bledisloe Cup Matches

British & Irish Lions Tests

International League Test Matches

World Championship Boxing and Wrestling

Nitro Circus and Nitro World Games

Major Concerts

Alan has also opened and run venues for 2 Olympic Games ‚Äì The Gabba for Sydney 2000 Football competition and the Beijing Olympic Basketball Arena for Beijing 2008, the only venue for the Beijing Olympics not run by a Chinese National.

He is a Co-Founder and Director of the Former Origin Greats, an elite and influential organisation comprising all players who have represented Queensland in State of Origin Football.

Alan is also heavily involved in charity work helping raise hundreds of thousands of dollars per year for a variety of local charities and community causes.

Show more

Jacopo Romeo

Jacopo, graduated in law at University of Naples Federico II, started to work as a journalist in Italy at 17 years old for newspapers and on Tv having more than 10 years experience in live broadcast. Communication in all of his aspect and football have been his main passion since he was a child. He has worked for Udinese Calcio since 2018 and believes in an innovative way of communicating, smart and oriented to the new media. He has been Head of Communication for the club since 2019.

Jacopo firmly believes that football should convey positive social messages thanks to its popularity and media power. Above all that the environmental sustainability and in all its aspects, an area in which he has been involved for 3 years thanks to the green policy launched by Udinese thanks also to Blunergy Stadium case history: an innovative and sustainable stadium owned by the club with the first solar park in Italy.

Matt Jones

Matt has nearly a decade of experience working in health, safety, risk, and compliance roles across a variety of attractions, events, stadia, and arenas.

Matt has driven successful culture change programmes across multisite organisations, including increasing H&S reporting by 2800% in one company.

Matt has worked at some industry leading organisations including Chester Zoo, Chester Race Company and now The ACC Liverpool Group, encompassing the M&S Bank Arena, as well as working at the British Transport Police in their wellbeing, health, and safety team.

Across all his roles Matt has gained a unique perspective into the operation and delivery of safe and secure publicly accessibly spaces and has worked with numerous software companies to develop and implement technological solutions to improve guest and colleague safety.

Greg Power

Greg Power is Director of Estates, Campus Strategy and Property Development at The RDS.

The Royal Dublin Society (RDS) is a philanthropic organisation founded in 1731, and owns one of Ireland‚Äôs most well-known venues ‚Äî RDS Arena.

The venue boasts a capacity of 18,500 and is the home ground of Leinster Rugby, which plays in the United Rugby Championship and Champions Cup. It also provides the backdrop for the annual Dublin Horse Show.

Greg is the Programme and Project Director for the new RDS Arena stand. Prior to entering the events and arena world, he was head of capital projects and master/space planning at two major universities.

Will Rayner

Will is the Chief Executive Officer of the Royal Agricultural and Horticultural Society (RA&HS) of South Australia. The RA&HS owns and operates a 27-hectare event, tourism, and exhibition site on the fringe of the central business district of SA‚Äôs capital city, Adelaide. The RA&HS‚Äôs premier event is the Royal Adelaide Show, which attracts more than 500,000 visitors each year

Will is also the Chairman and President of the South Australian Cricket Association, and a Director of the Adelaide Oval Stadium Management Authority (AOSMA). AOSMA operates the world famous ‚ÄòAdelaide Oval‚Äô, and 138-room ‚ÄòOval Hotel‚Äô. Will is a graduate of the Australian Institute of Company Directors and holds an MBA from the University of Adelaide.‚Äù

Marie Smyth

Since January 2012, Marie Smyth has been an integral part of the historic Croke Park Stadium, currently serving as the Head of Venue Business. With a career spanning over a decade at this iconic Irish venue, Marie has played a key role in shaping and enhancing the stadium‚Äôs corporate offerings.

In her capacity as the Head of Venue Business, Marie spearheads sales initiatives and coordinates a myriad of activities for Croke Park Premium, showcasing her strategic acumen in the competitive events and hospitality industry. Her responsibilities extend to overseeing Meeting & Events, where she ensures seamless coordination and execution of diverse gatherings.

Croke Park Stadium, with its storied history spanning over a century, holds a special place in Irish sporting heritage. Marie operates in a challenging yet thrilling environment with a capacity of 82,300, 110 event spaces, 94 suites, and over 8,700 premium seats under her purview. Her daily challenges are as diverse as the events hosted at the stadium.

Leading a dynamic team, Marie manages a wide array of clients, ranging from internal and external to national and international, including corporate and association clients.

Marie Smyth‚Äôs tenure at Croke Park Stadium is characterized by her unwavering commitment to excellence, her strategic vision for business development, and her passion for creating memorable experiences in one of Ireland‚Äôs most iconic venues.

Norman Vossschulte

Norman Vossschulte is originally from Berlin, Germany. His culturally rich background included 10 years living abroad in Africa, Iraq and Spain before moving back to Germany to finish high school and college. He studied Biology and Physical Science before deciding to move to New York City in 1996 to attend the Herbert Berghof Institute for Fine Theatre Arts and Drama.

Norman‚Äôs work experience is as eclectic as his upbringing. He has worked in the hotel industry, the non-profit sector, as well as both sports and entertainment industries. Twenty-five years of practicing customer and client relations have given him an overview of which techniques consistently enhance guest experiences. Norman has more than 17 years of staff training and team leadership experience working with The Walt Disney Company and currently the Philadelphia Eagles.

In 2014, Norman became the Eagles‚Äô official GO GREEN spokesperson. During his tenure leading the ‚Äúgreen team,‚Äù the Eagles have obtained LEED Gold certification and were the first sports team in the world to reach ISO 20121 certification. He organized and later re-branded the program, which included a new slogan ‚ÄúInnovate. Sustain.‚Äù and committee (ECO ‚Äì Engagement, Communication, Operations). The Eagles are also the first sports team to offset their carbon emissions through seagrass and mangrove restoration efforts, a partnership formed in June 2021 with Ocean Conservancy and The Ocean Foundation.

Most recently, Lincoln Financial Field became the first stadium in the world to have an onsite hydrogen production and fueling station to power its fleet of maintenance vehicles.

James de Groot

James de Groot joined Sodexo as a student placement back in 2004 and formed part of the team at Marylebone Cricket Club (MCC) that in-sourced the Food & Beverage Operation. James now oversees the delivery and strategic direction of Food & Beverage at MCC.

James sits on the Executive Management Board in his role as Chief F&B Officer; he‚Äôs successfully led six Ashes summers as well as delivered the ICC Men‚Äôs World Cup (2019), and the ICC Women‚Äôs World Cup (2017) ‚Äì both culminating in famous wins for England.

James and the Operations team ensure that the quality and range of food and beverage enhances the event and matchday experience, with a specific focus around the Member experience. Innovating is a key part of the role, exemplified by The Home of Food Festival which took place at Lord‚Äôs last September, and was the first non-cricket related food event to take place in the Club‚Äôs 210-year history. James led the strategy around food and drink, as well as the delivery across the weekend, including signing some of the UK most well-known and celebrated chefs, driving new sponsors and activations for the event. James was the pioneer behind Lord‚Äôs Ding Club, an award-winning series of exclusive dinners that operate inside the Grade II listed Pavilion, combining cricket, and Michelin-starred chefs.

The Club remains ‚Äòin-house‚Äô but partners with Moving Venue, Freemans and Tommy Banks/Made in Oldstead to deliver the operation for up to 31,000 spectators per match. Working with partners and suppliers to innovate to offer the best in-ground experience for spectators is a key strategic focus for James and his talented team.

James is passionate about sport, hospitality, food, drink and driving values through all aspects of service.

Sergii Khomenko

Sergii Khomenko is a techpreneur technology and eCommerce expert with over 20 years of experience, Sergii is Co-Founder of Autocanteen the UK‚Äôs first touchless self-checkout solution which increases checkout efficiency.,

Since his schooldays Sergii has had a deep interest in computers and technology and before founding Autocanteen he spent 10 years working in the ecommerce industry looking after and consulting ecommerce retailers.

Autocanteen is a touchless self-checkout solution which increases checkout efficiency. Disruptive innovation, no barcodes ‚Äì the system can identify anything from fruits to meal plates with visual discovery. Trusted by Fortune 500 companies.

Nick Sautner

Nick has 20 years‚Äô experience in stadium economics in his roles at Eden Park, Colonial Stadium, Telstra Dome, Etihad Stadium, Domain Stadium, and the West Australian Football Commission through his strategic and authentic leadership style.

Since commencing at Eden Park in 2017, Nick has implemented an integrated Icon Partnership program securing seven iconic brands including global market leaders Kia, Samsung, Vodafone and American Express. In addition, for the first time in Eden Park‚Äôs history, corporate suite inventory is fully occupied and stadium membership revenue growth has exceeded 40%.

Nick has also been instrumental in introducing key philanthropic initiatives with the Auckland Returned and Services Association as well as engaging the local community through a public art exhibition celebrating the neighbourhood surrounding Eden Park.

Nick has been committed to enhancing his business acumen and acquiring further technical skills and knowledge throughout his career. Nick has studied in China, Germany and America and holds Bachelor degrees in Business and in the Arts, as well as a Master of Business Administration (MBA) from the University of Melbourne.

Outside of work, Nick played 260 VFL matches and won 5 premierships with Sandringham and 2 VAFA premierships with Wesley Collegians. Amongst a number of individual honours, Nick kicked 883 goals in the VFL competition and holds the competition record for leading goal kicker.

In 2019 Nick was proud to receive the Executive of the Year award at TheStadiumBusiness Awards, and Venue Executive of the Year and Supreme Venue Person of the Year at the EVANZ Awards. He proudly became a Certified Venue Executive in 2020 with IAVM.

As part of his commitment to the community, he sits on The Auckland Children‚Äôs Christmas Parade Trust, the Akarana Marine Sports Trust and is a member of the British New Zealand Business Association Board.

Mary Norris

Mary Norris brings with her over 30 years of experience in sales and business development spanning diverse industries. Currently, she holds the position of Sales Director EMEA at Humanforce, a company committed to streamlining workforce management and human resources solutions for frontline and flexible workers. Before her role at Humanforce, Mary held key leadership positions at prominent companies, where she spearheaded initiatives related to integrated HR software solutions and the management of non-employee workforces on a global scale. Her extensive expertise has contributed significantly to the success and growth of the organizations she has been a part of.

Jonas Oliebos

Jonas Oliebos is a dedicated Digital Coordinator at KAA Gent, where he has been instrumental in advancing the club‚Äôs digital strategies since March 2021. He has a strong background in marketing and communication, campaign management, and project coordination. Passionate about sports and digital innovation, Jonas is committed to enhancing fan engagement and driving digital excellence in the sports industry.

Yannick Van de Voorde

Yannick Vandevoorde is a customer experience expert at Premium Plus, Zendesk EMEA Partner of the Year. As one of the driving forces behind KAA Gent‚Äôs successful CX strategy, he has helped along the team to transform fan engagement and customer support. Yannick‚Äôs innovative approach and deep understanding of industry trends make him a valuable asset in optimising operations and enhancing customer satisfaction. Passionate about continuous improvement, Yannick is dedicated to helping organisations achieve excellence in customer experience.

Tom Grant

Tom Grant, whose expertise as one of the Venue Safety Officers at Lord‚Äôs Cricket Ground has set industry benchmarks in safety and security. With a background in project management, Tom has overseen initiatives such as CCTV upgrades, continued enhancements in incident management systems, access control, accreditation platforms, turnstile infrastructure projects, and overlay planning.

His specialisation is the intersection of where safety management meets technological efficiencies and commercial success within the sporting landscape. Tom‚Äôs insights will draw from his experiences offering a unique perspective on enhancing operational efficiency, elevating spectator experience, and fostering a culture of safety excellence amongst the many challenges and opportunities within the stadium management industry.

Rebekah Murphy

Rebekah Murphy has an established track record in transformative software. Accelerated by working across commercial functions with a focus on building localised resources and leading dynamic teams. Rebekah is dedicated to serving 24/7 Software‚Äôs customers in EMEA, reaffirming their commitment to innovation and excellence in the venue operations industry.

Peter Evans

Peter Evans has 25 years of experience leading organizations‚Äô digital transformation and innovation activities for customers in the telecom, cloud, SaaS, and security industries, both cyber and physical. With Xtract One, Peter is bolstering the physical security technology industry while not only maintaining but improving the customer experience ‚Äì not just Xtract One‚Äôs customers, but their customers also. With an understanding of the operational challenges their customers face, Peter is driving the organization towards delivering solutions that replace outdated systems, augment current technology, and enhance existing resources.

Matja≈æ Mo≈æina

Matja≈æ Mo≈æina is the CEO of 2Mobile, an innovative leader with over two decades of experience in the mobile industry. His deep understanding of technology trends and passion for sports drive 2Mobile‚Äôs mission to revolutionize fan engagement through AI-powered solutions.

David Woodward

David have spent the last 5 years working within the hospitality industry covering stadiums, hotels and cruise liners for Aruba where our focus is to improve guest and employee experiences by providing a connectivity platform which can deliver unique fan and staff services.

Chryssi Soteriades

Chryssi Soteriades is a strategic account manager at AiFi for the UK, Ireland, Nordic and Baltics regions.

Chryssi is a Greek South African now based in Athens. She has research experience in emerging technologies and their impacts and has been invited as a guest speaker and panel member in numerous Technology and Beyond Humanism Forums.

At AiFi Chryssi has worked within the Product Team understanding the technology in depth. Currently she is focusing on strategic partnerships and the application of frictionless stores with renowned retailers.

Dorothy Tan

Dorothy Tan, the Chief Operating Officer at AsiaWorld-Expo Management Ltd. (AWE) since October 2019, meticulously oversees the company‚Äôs operations, including event planning and management, food and beverage services, customer service, and the venue operations and services teams. She is spearheading the renovation of AWE Phase 1‚Äôs facilities, enhancing them to set new industry benchmarks. Upon completing Phase 1, Tan will dedicate her efforts to the AWE Phase 2 expansion, a significant project aimed at extending and enhancing the venue‚Äôs capabilities to meet Hong Kong‚Äôs growing demands.

Tan brings an extensive 20-year background in retail leasing, property management, and valuation from Singapore and Hong Kong, where she has contributed to the success of numerous high-profile developments. She has held positions at former organizations such as the Kowloon-Canton Railway Corporation, The Mass Transport Rail Corporation, and the Airport Authority Hong Kong.

Simon Hanna

Simon Hanna joined Freemans Event Partners as Chief Operating Officer in 2023 to oversee the operational delivery of a five-year strategic plan and the implementation of a sustainability roadmap, further enhancing the customer experience through innovative hospitality, food and beverage, brand activations and payment solutions at events and venues both in the UK and overseas.

Simon‚Äôs extensive operational experience spans across 25 years, leading teams in large-scale food and beverage event environments and developing multi restaurant, bar and hospitality concepts; earlier forging his career within the independent, branded, country house and corporate hotels.

Since then, Simon has held various senior roles in multi-site, regional and national level operations, most recently as Regional Operations Director of Food & Beverage with The Jockey Club Cheltenham and Southwest where he oversaw the operations across four racecourses as well as the Henley Royal Regatta and the Blenheim Palace International Horse Trials.

Simon is passionate about sustainability and spearheaded the development and implementation of the Jockey Club Net Zero by 2027 sustainability strategy together with his team.

Gemma Vaughan

From Live Nation Entertainment to Escape to Freight Island and now the AO Arena, Gemma has spent 14 years at the heart of Manchester music. During her time at Escape to Freight Island, Gemma was key to the regeneration of the Depot Mayfield area, turning a historic former railway station into a diverse hub for arts music and culture right in Manchester‚Äôs city centre.

Ready for a new challenge, Gemma is now heading up the revenue streams for the ¬£50 million redevelopment of the AO Arena‚Äôs premium experiences as Director of Sales and Marketing. This will see the introduction of the UK‚Äôs first restaurant and bar experience inside a live music venue, solidifying the AO Arena as the beating heart of the City‚Äôs music scene.

Gemma is also a key ambassador across the City‚Äôs local initiatives, with the AO Arena being proud partners of Forever Manchester, This is Manchester Awards and The Manc.

Daniel Keane

Within his current role, Dan focuses on delivering the organisation‚Äôs growth strategy by overseeing the successful delivery of the project portfolio; ensuring alignment and delivery of both customer and business goals.

Prior to joining Vindico, Dan‚Äôs leadership and management experience was obtained within the Defence and Higher Education sectors, having held multiple leadership roles responsible for wide-ranging and varied operational services and portfolios.

Dan‚Äôs passionate about delivering innovative, high-quality outputs, keen on continuous improvement, and likes to think he and the wider Vindico team ‚Äòleave nothing on the pitch‚Äò; he‚Äôs also rather partial to a bad pun.

Andrew Smith

Andrew Smith, Sales Director UK, has worked in the AV industry for over 20 years. With particular expertise in the stadium and higher education sectors, Andrew has been working for a number of years with the likes of Crystal Palace, Arsenal, Wembley and Principality stadiums, Southbank University, Warner Brothers‚Äô Harry Potter Tour and many more well-known names across the UK.
